title: 14-kg heroin seized in Amritsar
text:
PK Jaiswar
Tribune News Service
Chhanmulla (Amritsar), October 17
The BSF thwarted yet another attempt of Pakistan-based smugglers to sneak in contraband into the state and seized 14-kg heroin, worth Rs 70 crore in the international market, near the Chhanmulla border outpost here today.
Sources said an exchange of fire also took place.
Fourteen packets of heroin packed in a cloth tube and put in a 12-feet-long plastic pipe (with four inch diameter) were found during the search operation, sources said.
Four pairs of slippers were also recovered from the area, pointing out that at least four persons were involved in the incident, they said.
“The alert BSF troops observed some suspicious movement near the barbed fence around 4 am today. When the troops challenged the persons approaching the fence, they started firing which was suitably retaliated by our jawans. However, the smugglers managed to escape taking advantage of darkness,” said officiating DIG, BSF, Amritsar sector, IP Bhatia.
“We fired around 38 rounds, besides some illumination rounds to see the smugglers during the five-hour-long operation,” said Bhatia.
Sources said the BSF personnel first observed the movement of Pakistani smugglers near the international border around 10.30 pm last night.
This is the fifth such incident in the Amritsar sector in the past 10 days. On October 14, the BSF had seized 12-kg heroin from the Chhina Bidhi Chand border outpost.
